intro: Rytigynia bugoyensis, commonly known as the Mindanao hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
